io.grpc

Class ServerInterceptors.ForwardingListener<RespT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.grpc.ServerCall.Listener<RespT>
      • io.grpc.ServerInterceptors.ForwardingListener<RespT>
  • Enclosing class:
    ServerInterceptors

    public static class ServerInterceptors.ForwardingListener<RespT>
extends ServerCall.Listener<RespT>
    Utility base class for decorating ServerCall.Listener instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ForwardingListener(ServerCall.Listener<RespT> delegate) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onCancel()
      The call was cancelled and the server is encouraged to abort processing to save resources, since the client will not process any further messages.
      void onComplete()
      The call is considered complete and ServerCall.Listener.onCancel() is guaranteed not to be called.
      void onHalfClose()
      The client completed all message sending.
      void onPayload(RespT payload)
      A request message has been received.
      void onReady(int numMessages)
      This indicates that the call is now capable of sending the given number of messages (via ServerCall.sendPayload(ResponseT)) without requiring excessive buffering internally.

    • Method Detail

      • onPayload

        public void onPayload(RespT payload)
        Description copied from class: ServerCall.Listener
        A request message has been received. For streaming calls, there may be zero or more request messages.
        Specified by:
        onPayload in class ServerCall.Listener<RespT>
        Parameters:
        payload - a received request message.

      • onHalfClose

        public void onHalfClose()
        Description copied from class: ServerCall.Listener
        The client completed all message sending. However, the call may still be cancelled.
        Specified by:
        onHalfClose in class ServerCall.Listener<RespT>

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel()
        Description copied from class: ServerCall.Listener
        The call was cancelled and the server is encouraged to abort processing to save resources, since the client will not process any further messages. Cancellations can be caused by timeouts, explicit cancellation by the client, network errors, etc.

        There will be no further callbacks for the call.

        Specified by:
        onCancel in class ServerCall.Listener<RespT>

      • onComplete

        public void onComplete()
        Description copied from class: ServerCall.Listener
        The call is considered complete and ServerCall.Listener.onCancel() is guaranteed not to be called. However, the client is not guaranteed to have received all messages.

        There will be no further callbacks for the call.

        Specified by:
        onComplete in class ServerCall.Listener<RespT>

      • onReady

        public void onReady(int numMessages)
        Description copied from class: ServerCall.Listener
        This indicates that the call is now capable of sending the given number of messages (via ServerCall.sendPayload(ResponseT)) without requiring excessive buffering internally. This event is just a suggestion and the application is free to ignore it, however doing so may result in excessive buffering within the call.

        NOTE: this method is not yet implemented!

        Overrides:
        onReady in class ServerCall.Listener<RespT>
        Parameters:
        numMessages - the number of messages that can be sent without requiring excessive buffering.
